file_content.text: Take care, Captain. Don't get blown up.
Captain. Did you get them?
Got them. Two dozen tickets to Garblaque's luxury dreadnaught.
Heh. That's our way out--no more running from Imp warships or Republic customs.
Hey--wait... damn it!
Don't tell me those things are fake.
Oh, they're real. They're just designated for deck seven--"nonhumanoids and ammonia-breathers only."
We can sell them, no problem, but we're not going anywhere.
Sure, things didn't go according to plan--I got ambushed, for one thing--but we're still talking about one hell of a score.
I'd still call that a win.
I know you wanted to get out, find somewhere safe. You probably deserve that pleasure cruise. But you'll be okay.
I'm sorry, Beryl.
You're one to talk. You could've gotten out ages ago if you wanted--you've lost more credits than I'll ever earn.
I was planning on selling my ticket anyway. No great loss.
I never really planned to go.
Well, of course you're not bothered. You've earned and spent how many fortunes, now? If you wanted to retire, you would've done it already.
I'm sorry, I just--tell me something. Why are you still here? Why keep fighting?
You know why. For all its faults, the Republic is the best hope we've got.
The Republic needs me.
I'm doing something good. And I won't abandon the people who rely on me.
Blast. I can actually understand that.
Sorry to disappoint.
The truth? I like the fight. I like doing and seeing things no one's seen or done before. I like not knowing if I'll make it through the day.
It's the thrill of it all.
It's not for everyone, but I wouldn't give it up.
So basically, you're a crazy person.
I've been called worse.
Thanks. For being honest.
You may think you understand me, Beryl. But you never will. My reasons are my own.
You'll never know.
I don't think it's that complicated. I think you just like to hurt people, and the rest is an excuse.
Guess so. The weird thing is--I think you're a decent person. But even decent people call it quits sometime.
Anyway, we can always rely on money. Something to remember next scheme.
It's not a way out, but if you want more than money, I know plenty of people who could use a smart captain and a fast ship.
Let me find you good work.
Doesn't have to be privateer work. The Supreme Chancellor owes me a few favors.
Are you trying to make a hero out of me?
Just trying to get you out of my hair.
I'm not desperate for work. But for the right kind of job... yeah. All right. You've got a deal.
So--back to business.
The way you're acting, there won't be a next scheme. Quit looking for outs--learn to fight.
Don't be so weak.
Charming advice, Captain.
Now about those tickets...
I'll keep my end of the bargain and you'll get your cut. Plenty of rich Hutts and Arcona out there.
Too bad the only people who can afford tickets don't really need them. The ones who've already got gangs and armies for protection.
There are nonhumanoids and ammonia-breathers out there who could use an escape. Folks hit hard by the conflict.
Give the tickets to the needy.
Yes, there are.
Ortolans watching their home on Hoth turn into a battleground. Refugees on Nar Shaddaa...
I think I can find a few dozen worthy candidates. But we're not getting rich today.
Never figured we were.
Me, neither. I'm glad.
It's not fair, but no one's hurt and we come out richer.
Ironic, but that's life.
We do, don't we?
I should get going. If I'm really going to start working for the Republic, I've got a few messes to clean up first.
I should run. Lots of angry pirates, that sort of thing. You know the drill.
You sure you can't stick around? One drink. Maybe three.
Next time, but you're buying.
You make a fair point. What's a crime lord leaving known space going to do with his thugs?
I want those gangs for myself.
I don't need money. Tell your buyers that in exchange for tickets, I want their people to serve me.
I don't know if I'm comfortable doing that....
If they've got a problem, I'll talk to them.
I bet you will. Okay.
I should get off Rishi before the pirates hunt me down--you know the drill.
I know the drill. I'll see you around, Beryl Thorne.
Take care of yourself, Captain--and get back to saving the galaxy. For all of us who're stuck here.
I'll be on the comm. Watch yourself, Captain.
Captain.
Beryl. So what have you been up to?
Got offered a privateer contract like you. Turned it down--not my thing--but I was flying war supplies for a while.
Then the Senate passed a bill saying persons with a criminal record can't fly war supplies. So it's been rough since then.
Where's your droid? Argo?
Lost him escaping Nar Shaddaa when the Hutt Cartel infighting started. Like I said, it's been rough.
What about you? Heard rumors you've been busy.
Somehow, I've ended up a troubleshooter for the Chancellor and the SIS.
Just playing hero, I guess.
After the Voidwolf, I was on Ilum, Makeb, Tython--they say the Republic would collapse without me.
You're good, but I think someone's feeding your ego.
Sounds like what you've been through has been more than rough. You want to talk?
Forget me. You okay?
Thank you. No. Really, being alive makes me one of the lucky ones.
Anyway, on to business. You ever heard of Garblaque the Hutt?
That's about all the chit-chat I can take. You have a way to make money, I'm listening.
Let's skip to the job.
All right. You ever heard of Garblaque the Hutt?
Rings a distant bell.
Former businessman, retired to a moon of Hosko about a decade back. Pretty sedate tastes for a Hutt, likes to avoid trouble.
Now, with the Cartel-Republic alliance, he's terrified of being caught in the crossfire. So he came up with a plan.
And what plan is that?
Garblaque built a luxury dreadnaught, and he's leaving known space on a ten-year pleasure cruise. Thinks the war will be over when he gets back.
The galaxy's a big place, and I've seen how Hutts define "luxury." Might not be a bad trip.
That's crazy... and brilliant.
You said it.
If he's that rich, I don't care how big his ship is--he'd have to leave a fortune behind.
He leaving his wealth behind?
That's just it--the ship is too big. He bankrupted himself, so he's auctioning off seats--thousands of them.
The war's only getting worse, and if it's over in ten years? I doubt Garblaque will like the outcome.
That plan is optimistic.
Maybe, but if that's the case, I'd still rather be on a luxury cruiser.
Here's the thing, though. Even Garblaque can't pay for his ship and supplies in cash. He's auctioning off seats--thousands of them.
So anyone with the money can escape the war with him.
The ticket prices are crazy--half the galaxy wants out, but only kingpins and big shots can afford it.
Think, Captain: How much would you pay to hang up those blasters and join a ten-year pleasure cruise?
To be clear, when you say "pleasure cruise"--just how nice is this dreadnaught?
That does sound like fun....
Think marble floors, fur carpets, and a massage droid in every cabin.
That does sound nice.
I heard something about a "wine spa," too, but that can't be what it sounds like.
Are you looking to get out? No more jobs, no more shootouts--just a nice retirement plan?
Is that what you want to do?
Is that wrong? Hutts can be good conversationalists, and I'm just--I'm tired of the fighting. You must be, too.
Leaving everything to jump on a ship full of Hutts and gutless corporate honchos? Not my style.
I'm not even tempted.
Maybe, but think! And what about your crew? Would they agree?
What's your pitch, Beryl?
I've got a lead on two dozen tickets stolen by pirates and stowed on Rishi. I can sell them for ten times what they're worth.
We steal the tickets, we split the profits. We can even keep a few ourselves.
Haven't run a heist like this since that Imperial treasury ship. So where are the tickets now?
You've got a deal.
One last big score and we run off together in style. I can think of worse endings.
[Flirt] You and me, we'll do it.
Not an ending--a new beginning.
You're a better crook than I gave you credit for. How come we haven't done this since Taris?
We should do this more often.
You, Risha, law enforcement... the usual.
So where do we find the tickets?
I like it. But out of curiosity, what keeps me from grabbing the tickets and running off?
Great. So why do I need you?
Either honor or greed: I already have a list of bidders from the ticket auction. Trust me, you'll come out ahead.
Had to ask. So where are the tickets now?
That's the tricky part. These pirates have cargo stowed all over, and there's no way we can search it all.
But... I've sliced into their cargo droid registry. If you make it look like there's a raid on their property, blow things up....
...then they'll send a droid to make sure the tickets are safe.
Exactly. I'll tell you where the droid is heading, and you just grab the tickets first.
Blow things up, watch the droids, steal the tickets. Not a problem.
You forgot the last part: Get rich.
Rishi. As backwaters go, it's... pretty far back.
Ever since the Voidwolf, I've been saving the day all over the galaxy. They say the Republic would collapse without me.
